com.example.appraisal.backend.trial

Class Trial

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.appraisal.backend.trial.Trial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Trial>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinomialTrial, CountTrial, MeasurementTrial, NonNegIntCountTrial

    public abstract class Trial
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Trial>
    This is the Trial abstract class that all trial subclass should share This mainly ensures reading and writing data from all trial subclass are unified The trial objects can be sorted by its trial value. If other sorts are desired, please implement custom Comparator

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(@NonNull
                     Trial o)
        This method makes the Trial class comparable based on its trial value
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Trial>
        Parameters:
        o - -- the other trial object being compared to

      • setValue

        public abstract void setValue(double value)
        This method sets the current value of the trial For Bernoulli trials (i.e. Binomials), 1 = success, 0 = failure For Count trial, setting the value to be 0 makes the trial invalid Note: It is recommended to use the class native method if possible (e.g. for BernoulliTrial it is setToSuccess() and setToFailure())
        Parameters:
        value - -- the value that the trial sets to

      • getValue

        public abstract double getValue()
        This method get the value of a trial For Bernoulli trials, it wil return 1 to indicate success, and 0 for failure For count trial, it will return 1 if the trial is valid
        Returns:
        double -- value of the trial

      • overrideDate

        public void overrideDate(java.util.Date date)
        This method overrides the create date of the trial The trial's create date is default to the current date
        Parameters:
        date - -- the date which the trial date overrides to

      • getParentExperiment

        public Experiment getParentExperiment()
        This method returns which experiment the trial belongs to
        Returns:
        Experiment -- the parent experiment

      • getTrialDate

        public java.util.Date getTrialDate()
        This method returns the date which the trial is conducted

      • getConductor

        public User getConductor()
        This method returns the User that conducted the trial
        Returns:
        User -- the conductor of the trial

      • getType

        public TrialType getType()
        This method returns the type of the experiment. It matches the create key of TrialFactory
        Returns:
        TrialType -- the create key of this type of trial
